arctic.description: Dramatic reductions in Arctic sea ice threaten ecosystems and fisheries, disrupt traditional lifestyles, and erode coastlines. Increasing development activities may boost the region’s economy, but they also increase risks to ecosystems and the environment. Explore landcover, current drought, and historical observations in this rapidly changing region.

group1.title: BIA Lands and Arctic Sea Ice
group1.description: Explore the environmental changes Alaska Native Villages have seen as the extent of September Arctic sea ice has decreased over time.

group2.title: Energy Infrastructure and Permafrost
group2.description: Explore where energy infrastructure sits atop permafrost that is increasingly susceptible to melting.

coastal.description: As sea level rises, so do instances of flooding along the coast. Rising waters increasingly threaten buildings and infrastructure through storm surge, strong waves, heavy precipitation, and high-tide "nuisance" flooding. Property owners and municipalities can check their vulnerability to coastal flooding from current flood hazards as well as future sea level rise.

group1.title: Critical Facilities and Sea Level Rise
group1.description: Explore which critical coastal facilities are threatened by sea level rise.

group2.title: Development and Coastal Flooding
group2.description: Explore how developed coastal areas are threatened by shallow coastal floods.

group3.title: Public Attractions and Coastal Vulnerability
group3.description: Explore which landmark buildings are located in areas susceptible to sea-level rise.

group4.title: Hurricane Evacuation and Storm Surge
group4.description: Explore where hurricane evacuation routes may be threatened by storm surge.

group5.title: Coastal Power and Storm Surge
group5.description: Explore which coastal power plants may be vulnerable to storm surge.

ecosystems.description: Ecosystems that serve as natural sources of food, timber, and clean water are increasingly threatened by changing conditions. View landcover, wetlands, and rivers & streams to visualize the location and extent of land-based ecosystems. Compare these locations to climate stressors such as sea level rise and drought.

group1.title: Coastal wetlands and sea level rise
group1.description: Explore how wetlands, natural areas, and open spaces along coasts are threatened by sea level rise.

group2.title: Polution sources and flood hazards
group2.description: Explore which ecosystems within flood hazard zones could be contaminated by potential pollution sources.

group3.title: Critial Habitat and Temperatures
group3.description: Explore areas of critical habitat for threatened and endangered species. Check how future maximum temperatures are projected to change in these locations in the coming decades.

group4.title: Forests and Days Below Freezing
group4.description: Explore National Forests and check where reductions in days below 32° may enable insects such as bark beetles to survive and thrive during winter.

energy.description: As temperatures warm, demand for energy is expected to increase. Exposed energy infrastructure—particularly along our coasts—may lead to disruptions in energy supply. Managers of energy assets can check current flood hazards as well as visualizations of flooding from future sea level rise.

food.description: Increasing heat waves, drought, and very heavy precipitation have the potential to reduce agricultural productivity in future decades. Changes in crop yields and livestock production can increase food prices and reduce food security.

health.description: Increases in extreme weather events, poor air quality, and transmittable illnesses threaten human health. Explore areas where high percentages of residents are elderly and/or poor, and where other factors increase social vulnerability. People in these areas may require assistance during events such as heat waves, storms, or flooding.

marine.description: This is the main topic desciption. Should include overview of all groups on the page. It goes on the main headline on the topics page

transportation.description: Extreme events increasingly threaten land-, water-, and air-based transportation systems and supply chains. View the location of transportation assets such as highways, bridges, and airports, and check to see where they coincide with flooding hazards and the risk of inundation from sea level rise.

tribal_nations.description: Climate change increasingly impacts land, foods, and lifestyles of American Indians. Survey the extent of Indian land and explore landcover and social vulnerability in these locations. Check the land's vulnerability to climate stressors such as sea level rise, flood hazards, and drought.

water.description: Changing conditions are increasing threats of both flooding and drought. Flood zone maps can help you identify areas that are at risk of flooding and the current drought layer shows which regions are abnormally dry or experiencing drought. View the land cover layer to get a sense of what may be impacted by flooding or drought.

weather_stations.title: Weather Stations
weather_stations.description: Check how observed temperature and precipitation measurements compare to long-term averages at weather stations near your area of interest. Look for times when temperatures are above average and/or precipitation is below average for weeks at a time: these indicate times that drought conditions may develop.

bia_indian_lands.title: BIA Indian Lands
bia_indian_lands.description: This layer shows  American Indian Reservations, Federally Recognized Tribal Entities, and Alaska Native Villages in the contiguous U.S. and Alaska.

september_arctic_sea_ice.title: September Arctic Sea Ice
september_arctic_sea_ice.description: View how Arctic sea ice—shown in September of each year from 2000-2015 has changed over time. Reduced sea ice restricts the range of subsistence hunters, and exposes the coast to erosion.

energy_infrastructure.title: Energy Infrastructure
energy_infrastructure.description: Check the locations of power plants and oil and gas refineries. View the paths of pipelines that transport energy materials and transmission wires that distribute electricity.

permafrost.title: Permafrost
permafrost.description: Check where the ground is currently considered to be “permanently” frozen. Thawing permafrost can result in damage to infrastructure when the ground surface becomes uneven or unstable. Permafrost is categorized as continuous, discontinuous, sporadic, or isolated, based on its areal extent.

critical_coastal_facilities.title: Critical Coastal Facilities
critical_coastal_facilities.description: View locations of hospitals, schools, and fire and police stations along the Atlantic and Gulf Coasts. If flooded, these structures present an immediate threat to life, public health, and safety.

sea_level_rise.title: Sea Level Rise (For 1 to 6 feet)
sea_level_rise.description: View areas that will be covered by seawater during high tides after the indicated amount of local sea level rise. A few inches of water will cover the lightest blue areas; water will be deeper where the map is dark blue. Bright green areas will be below sea level, but are not connected to the ocean. Visualize changes over time by turning on progressively higher sea levels.

development_density.title: Development Density
development_density.description: View the intensity of development across land based on the percentage of constructed versus natural materials at each location. Areas that are essentially covered by buildings are classified as high intensity development. Parks and other areas with less than 20 percent constructed materials are considered as open space.

shallow_coastal_flooding.title: Shallow Coastal Flooding
shallow_coastal_flooding.description: View coastal areas susceptible to flooding during high tide. These “nuisance” floods can occur during very high tides, or when distant winds push seawater onto land.

public_attractions.title: Public Attractions
public_attractions.description: View non-emergency structures catalogued in the National Map.

coastal_vulnerability_index.title: Coastal Vulnerability Index
coastal_vulnerability_index.description: Check which coastal areas are most susceptible to change as a result of sea-level rise. Index values are based on physical parameters such as the shape of the coast, tidal range, and average wave heights.

hurricane_evacuation.title: Hurricane Evactuation Routes
hurricane_evacuation.description: View major roads designated as hurricane evacuation routes.

storm_surge.title: Storm Surge (Categories 1-5)
storm_surge.description: View potential inundation due to storm-surge flooding from landfalling hurricanes of categories 1-5.

coastal_power_plants.title: Coastal Power Plants
coastal_power_plants.description: View locations and types of power plants along the U.S. coast and Great Lakes.

coastal_wetlands.title: Coastal Wetlands
coastal_wetlands.description: View wetlands and other natural areas along the coast.

flood_hazard_zones.title: Flood Hazard Zones
flood_hazard_zones.description: Check which local areas have been designated by FEMA to be at risk of flooding. Aqua areas show land judged to have a 1% chance of flooding each year; this area is also known as the base flood zone or 100-year flood zone. Colors and patterns also indicate floodways and other hazard areas.

polution_sources.title: Potential Polution Sources
polution_sources.description: View facilities, sites, or places subject to environmental regulation or of environmental interest such as Brownfield properties, hazardous waste sites, Superfund sites, and toxic chemicals.

critical_habitat.title: Critical Habitit
critical_habitat.description: View the location of habitat designated as critical in order to preserve the ecosystems where threatened and endangered species live.

mean_daily_max.title: Mean Daily Max Temperature Forecast (2090)
mean_daily_max.description: Maximum temperatures are one indicator of conditions that can interfere with ecosystem functions. View how temperatures are projected to change during future decades.

national_forests.title: National Forests
national_forests.description: View the location and extent of lands designated as National Forests.

days_tmin_blw_0.title: Days below 32 degrees 2090
days_tmin_blw_0.description: View how the number of days per year with below-freezing temperatures decreases over time.
